meanings.definition: A space left in underground mining after ore has been extracted.
meanings.sent1: The miners explored the dark stope carefully.
meanings.sent2: The stope was empty after all the ore was removed.
meanings.sent3: The stope seemed like a mysterious underground room.
meanings.sent4: The stope yawned like a hungry mouth waiting to be filled.
meanings.sent5: The stope echoed with the sounds of pickaxes and shovels.

meanings.definition: To extract ore from a stope.
meanings.sent1: The miners worked hard to stope the valuable minerals.
meanings.sent2: They needed to stope carefully to avoid cave-ins.
meanings.sent3: The miners joked that they were 'stope artists' sculpting the earth.
meanings.sent4: She had to stope through layers of rock to reach the ore.
meanings.sent5: The machine hummed as it began to stope the rich vein of ore.

meanings.sent2: His quick reflexes prevented the stope of the falling rocks.
meanings.sent3: The stope of the music made the party awkward.
